Start with brute force, then optimize

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: String immutability (Python/Java) - creates new string each concat

concepts.title: Recursion Thinking Process
checklist: Trust the recursive call (leap of faith)
Identify what current level should do

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Watch for stack overflow on deep recursion

checklist: Permutation pattern (use visited array or swap)
Combination pattern (use start index, no revisit)

concepts.title: Merge Sort

checklist: Time: O(n log n) avg, O(n²) worst | Space: O(log n)

concepts.title: Heap Sort
checklist: Time: O(n log n) | Space: O(1)

concepts.title: Radix Sort
checklist: Time: O(d × (n + k)) | Space: O(n + k)

concepts.title: Bucket Sort
checklist: Time: O(n + k) avg | Space: O(n)

concepts.title: Cyclic Sort Pattern (Grokking Pattern #5)
checklist: Cyclic Sort concept (place each number at its correct index)
Find Corrupt Pair (one missing, one duplicate)

concepts.title: Basics
checklist: Time: O(log n) | Space: O(1) or O(log n)

checklist: Template for "minimum value that satisfies condition"
Template for "maximum value that satisfies condition"

concepts.title: Basic
checklist: Count of Element in Sorted Array

checklist: Minimum Days to Make M Bouquets

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Binary search requires SORTED array (or monotonic condition)
Be careful with mid calculation to avoid overflow
Watch for infinite loops (wrong termination condition)
Know when to use left < right vs left <= right
Understand which bound to return (lower vs upper)

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Wrong mid calculation: use mid = left + (right - left) // 2
Infinite loop due to wrong boundary update
Not handling edge cases (empty, single element)

concepts.title: When to Use Binary Search on Answer
checklist: "Minimum X such that condition is satisfied"
"Maximum X such that condition is satisfied"
Answer lies in a known range [lo, hi]
Can verify if a value works in O(n) or less

concepts.title: Basic Operations
checklist: Insertion at end - O(n) or O(1) with tail

concepts.title: Operations
checklist: Insertion at end - O(1) with tail
Deletion from end - O(1) with tail

concepts.title: Concept
checklist: Two pointers moving at different speeds

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Use dummy node to simplify edge cases (empty list, single node)
Always check for null before accessing .next
Consider both singly and doubly linked list approaches
Draw pictures to visualize pointer movements
Fast & slow pointer is key for many problems

concepts.title: Corner Cases
checklist: Cycle at different positions (head, middle, tail)

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Not updating pointers in correct order

concepts.title: Design Problems
checklist: Design a Stack with Increment Operation

concepts.title: Priority Queue
checklist: Covered in detail in Heaps topic

concepts.title: Sliding Window Maximum (Deque)
checklist: Longest Continuous Subarray with Absolute Diff

concepts.title: Other Queue Problems
checklist: First Unique Character in a Stream

concepts.title: Problems
checklist: Shortest Subarray with Sum at Least K

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Check for empty stack/queue before pop/peek
Use deque for sliding window problems
Stack is LIFO, Queue is FIFO - know when to use which
BFS uses queue, DFS uses stack

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Not handling all types of brackets

concepts.title: Binary Tree Basics
checklist: Maximum nodes in tree of height H = 2^(H+1) - 1

concepts.title: Types of Binary Trees
checklist: Complete Binary Tree (all levels filled except last)
Perfect Binary Tree (all internal nodes have 2 children)

concepts.title: Ancestor Problems
checklist: Maximum Difference Between Node and Ancestor

concepts.title: Construction Problems
checklist: Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List

concepts.title: Problems
checklist: Encode N-ary Tree to Binary Tree

concepts.title: Recursive Tree Template
checklist: Understand the general recursive tree pattern:

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Always handle null/empty tree case first
Recursion is natural for trees - trust the recursive call
Consider both DFS (recursion/stack) and BFS (queue) approaches
Many problems need info from both subtrees
Return multiple values when needed (tuple or class)

concepts.title: Corner Cases
checklist: Skewed tree (all left or all right)

concepts.title: BST Properties
checklist: Search, Insert, Delete: O(log n) average

concepts.title: Validation
checklist: Check if Two BSTs are Same
Check if BST Contains Dead End

concepts.title: LCA in BST
checklist: (Easier than general BT - use BST property)

concepts.title: Conversion
checklist: BST to Sorted Doubly Linked List

concepts.title: Advanced Problems
checklist: Unique Binary Search Trees II (Generate all)

concepts.title: Language Built-ins
checklist: C++ STL: set, map, multiset, multimap

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: BST property: ALL left subtree < root < ALL right subtree
Use min/max bounds for validation (not just parent comparison)
BST allows O(log n) average, but O(n) worst case if skewed
Self-balancing trees (AVL, Red-Black) guarantee O(log n)

concepts.title: Corner Cases
checklist: Skewed tree (all left or all right) - worst case O(n)
Duplicate values (typically not allowed in BST)

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Validating BST with only parent-child comparison (wrong!)
Not handling delete with two children correctly

concepts.title: Heap Properties
checklist: Root is always min (min-heap) or max (max-heap)
Complete binary tree (filled left to right)

concepts.title: Insert (Push)
checklist: Compare with parent, swap if needed

concepts.title: Extract Min/Max (Pop)
checklist: Compare with children, swap with smaller/larger

concepts.title: Build Heap
checklist: Heapify from last non-leaf to root
Time: O(n) - not O(n log n)!

concepts.title: K-way Merge Pattern (Grokking Pattern #14)
checklist: Smallest Range Covering Elements from K Lists
Find K Pairs with Smallest Sums
Kth Smallest Number in M Sorted Lists
Kth Smallest Number in Sorted Matrix

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Python heapq is MIN-heap only - negate values for max-heap
For Kth LARGEST use min-heap of size K
For Kth SMALLEST use max-heap of size K
Heapify is O(n), not O(n log n)
For custom objects, use tuples (priority, object)

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Using wrong heap type (max vs min) for the problem
Forgetting to negate for max-heap in Python
Confusing heap size K vs pop K times

concepts.title: Hash Function
checklist: What makes a good hash function?

concepts.title: Common Hash Functions
checklist: Division method: h(k) = k mod m

concepts.title: Structure
checklist: Hash function maps key to index

concepts.title: Chaining (Open Hashing)
checklist: Each bucket is a linked list
Worst case: O(n) if all collide

concepts.title: Open Addressing (Closed Hashing)
checklist: Linear Probing: h(k, i) = (h(k) + i) mod m
Quadratic Probing: h(k, i) = (h(k) + i²) mod m
Double Hashing: h(k, i) = (h₁(k) + i*h₂(k)) mod m

concepts.title: Subarray Sum Problems
checklist: Maximum Size Subarray Sum Equals k
Number of Subarrays with Bounded Maximum

concepts.title: Two Pointer + Hash
checklist: Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters
Find All Anagrams in a String

concepts.title: Rolling Hash
checklist: Efficiently compute hash of sliding window

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Hash map gives O(1) average lookup - use for fast search
Use defaultdict or Counter for cleaner counting
Consider space vs time tradeoff (hash map uses O(n) space)

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Modifying dict while iterating (use list(d.keys()) first)
Confusing `in d` (checks keys) vs value lookup
Using mutable objects as keys (lists can't be keys)
Forgetting to handle key not found

concepts.title: When NOT to Use Hash Map
checklist: Need sorted order → use BST or sorted array

concepts.title: What is a Graph?
checklist: Graph vs Tree (tree is a connected acyclic graph)

concepts.title: Adjacency List
checklist: Each vertex has list of neighbors

concepts.title: Union-Find / Disjoint Set (Grokking Pattern #30)
checklist: Number of Operations to Make Network Connected

concepts.title: Shortest Path Problems
checklist: Find the City With Smallest Number of Neighbors

concepts.title: What is MST?
checklist: Spanning tree with minimum total edge weight

concepts.title: MST Problems
checklist: Min Cost to Connect All Points
Optimize Water Distribution in a Village

concepts.title: Grid Traversal
checklist: Pattern: For each direction, check bounds before processing

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Clarify: directed vs undirected, weighted vs unweighted
Choose right representation (adjacency list usually better)
BFS for shortest path in unweighted, Dijkstra for weighted
Topological sort only works on DAGs

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Forgetting to mark nodes as visited
Infinite loops in graphs with cycles
Using DFS when BFS needed (shortest path)

concepts.title: When to Use DP?
checklist: Optimal substructure: optimal solution contains optimal solutions to subproblems
Overlapping subproblems: same subproblems solved multiple times

concepts.title: Top-Down (Memoization)
checklist: Pattern: Check memo → Base case → Compute → Store → Return

concepts.title: Bottom-Up (Tabulation)
checklist: Pattern: Initialize dp array → Set base cases → Fill dp table → Return answer

concepts.title: Space Optimization
checklist: Often only need last few states
Pattern: Use 2-3 variables instead of array
Example: Fibonacci needs only prev1, prev2 → O(1) space

concepts.title: Linear DP
checklist: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock with Cooldown
Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock with Transaction Fee

concepts.title: 0/1 Knapsack
checklist: Each item used at most once

concepts.title: Unbounded Knapsack
checklist: Each item can be used unlimited times

concepts.title: Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS)
checklist: O(n²) approach: `dp[i] = max(dp[j] + 1)` for all j < i where `nums[j] < nums[i]`
O(n log n) approach: Use binary search with patience sorting

concepts.title: Matrix Chain Multiplication (Interval DP)
checklist: Pattern: For each length → For each start i → For each split k
Recurrence: `dp[i][j] = min(dp[i][k] + dp[k+1][j] + cost(i,k,j))` for all k in [i,j)

concepts.title: Problems
checklist: Maximum Product of Splitted Binary Tree

concepts.title: Stock Problems
checklist: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock III
Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV

concepts.title: Concept
checklist: Use bitmask to represent set state

concepts.title: Problems
checklist: Minimum Cost to Visit Every Node
Partition to K Equal Sum Subsets

concepts.title: Problems
checklist: Numbers At Most N Given Digit Set

concepts.title: 5-Step DP Problem-Solving Framework
checklist: **Step 1:** Define the state - What variables define a subproblem?
**Step 2:** Define the recurrence relation - How to combine smaller solutions?
**Step 3:** Define base cases - What are the smallest subproblems?
**Step 4:** Determine computation order - Top-down or bottom-up?

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Consider if greedy works (simpler than DP)

concepts.title: What is Greedy?
checklist: Make best choice at each step
Hope local optimum leads to global optimum
Not always optimal, but often efficient

concepts.title: When Does Greedy Work?
checklist: Greedy Choice Property: local optimal → global optimal
Optimal Substructure: optimal solution contains optimal sub-solutions

concepts.title: Greedy Stays Ahead
checklist: Show greedy solution stays ≥ any other solution at each step
By induction, greedy is optimal at the end

concepts.title: Exchange Argument
checklist: Assume optimal solution differs from greedy
Show we can exchange to match greedy without worsening

concepts.title: Activity Selection / Interval Scheduling
checklist: Pattern: Sort by end → Take first → Take next non-overlapping

concepts.title: Interval Problems
checklist: Minimum Number of Arrows to Burst Balloons

concepts.title: Array Greedy
checklist: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II

concepts.title: Sort Then Greedy
checklist: Pattern: Sort by criteria → Iterate items → If valid, take it → Accumulate result

concepts.title: Heap-Based Greedy
checklist: Pattern: Build heap → Pop best → Process → Re-insert if needed

concepts.title: Local to Global
checklist: Update global when local is complete

concepts.title: Easy
checklist: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II

concepts.title: Hard
checklist: Minimum Cost to Hire K Workers

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Greedy doesn't always work - verify with counterexamples first
Think about the sorting criteria carefully
Ask: "Does local optimal lead to global optimal?"

concepts.title: What is a Trie?
checklist: Also called Prefix Tree or Digital Tree

concepts.title: Why Use Trie?
checklist: Fast prefix-based searches: O(m) where m = word length

concepts.title: Representation
checklist: Using Array of size 26 (lowercase letters only)

concepts.title: Core Methods
checklist: `insert(word)` - Add word to trie, increment prefix counts
`search(word)` - Check if exact word exists (is_end = True)
`startsWith(prefix)` - Check if any word starts with prefix
`_find_node(prefix)` - Helper to navigate to prefix node

concepts.title: Extended Methods
checklist: `get_all_words(prefix)` - Get all words starting with prefix using DFS

concepts.title: Basic Trie Problems
checklist: Design Add and Search Words Data Structure

concepts.title: XOR Problems (Bit Trie)
checklist: Maximum XOR of Two Numbers in an Array
Maximum XOR With an Element From Array
Count Pairs With XOR in a Range

concepts.title: Compressed Trie (Radix Tree)
checklist: Used in: routing tables, text indexing

concepts.title: Suffix Trie
checklist: Insert all suffixes of a string

concepts.title: Bit Trie (Binary Trie)
checklist: Each node has 0/1 children (array of size 2)
Insert: Traverse from MSB to LSB (bit 31 to 0), create nodes
Max XOR: Try to go opposite direction at each bit for maximum XOR
Applications: XOR problems, range XOR queries

concepts.title: Autocomplete System
checklist: Store sentences in Trie with frequency counts
On input: Get all words with current prefix

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Use dict for flexible charset, array[26] for lowercase only
Always mark is_end for complete words
Consider space tradeoff (Trie uses more memory than hash map)

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Forgetting to mark is_end on insert

concepts.title: What is Segment Tree?
checklist: Each node stores aggregate of a range
Supports: sum, min, max, GCD, etc.

concepts.title: Operations
checklist: **Build**: Recursively build from leaves to root - O(n)
**Update**: Update leaf, propagate up to root - O(log n)
**Query**: Recursively combine overlapping ranges - O(log n)
Key insight: Check if range is outside, fully inside, or partial overlap

concepts.title: Segment Tree Problems
checklist: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self

concepts.title: Key Insight
checklist: tree[i] stores sum of elements in range
Range determined by lowest set bit

concepts.title: Operations
checklist: **Update(i, delta)**: Add delta to index i

concepts.title: BIT Problems
checklist: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self

concepts.title: Operations
checklist: **Find**: Which set does element belong to?

concepts.title: Optimizations
checklist: **Union by Rank/Size**: Attach smaller to larger

concepts.title: Operations
checklist: **Union(x, y)**: Merge sets containing x and y
Track component count: decrement on successful union

concepts.title: What is Sparse Table?
checklist: O(1) query after O(n log n) preprocessing
Works for idempotent operations (min, max, GCD)

concepts.title: What is Skip List?
checklist: O(log n) average for search, insert, delete

concepts.title: Structure
checklist: Bottom level: all elements in sorted order
Each element randomly promoted to higher levels
Search: Start from top-left, go right or down

concepts.title: Implementation Pattern (HashMap + Doubly Linked List)
checklist: Key insight: Store key in node to delete from HashMap when evicting

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Union-Find is MOST common in interviews (connected components)
LRU Cache is a classic design question
Segment Tree/BIT rarely asked - know concepts only
Path compression + union by rank = near O(1)

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Wrong update order in doubly linked list

concepts.title: Binary Representation
checklist: Example: Decimal 5 = Binary 00000101, Decimal -5 = Binary 11111011 (8-bit two's complement)

concepts.title: AND (&)
checklist: Use: Check if bit is set, clear bits

concepts.title: OR (|)
checklist: At least one bit must be 1

concepts.title: XOR (^)
checklist: Use: Toggle bits, find unique element

concepts.title: Check if Power of 2
checklist: Power of 2 has exactly one bit set

concepts.title: Count Set Bits (Population Count)
checklist: Basic: Loop through bits, count `n & 1`, right shift
Brian Kernighan's Algorithm: `n &= (n-1)` clears rightmost set bit - O(set bits)

concepts.title: Swap Without Temp
checklist: Pattern: `a ^= b; b ^= a; a ^= b`

concepts.title: Applications
checklist: Find single number in array (all others appear twice)

concepts.title: Basic Problems
checklist: Single Number II (appears once, others 3 times)
Single Number III (two numbers appear once)

concepts.title: Subset Generation
checklist: Pattern: For mask 0 to 2^n - 1, if bit i is set, include nums[i]

concepts.title: Bitmask DP Problems
checklist: Partition to K Equal Sum Subsets

concepts.title: Advanced Problems
checklist: Count Pairs With XOR in Range
Minimum XOR Sum of Two Arrays

concepts.title: Iterate Through Set Bits
checklist: Pattern: While n > 0, get lowest bit with `n & (-n)`, clear with `n &= (n-1)`

concepts.title: Iterate Through All Subsets of a Mask
checklist: Pattern: `subset = mask; while subset: process(subset); subset = (subset-1) & mask`

concepts.title: Bitmask for State
checklist: Track visited nodes: `visited |= (1 << node)` to mark, `visited & (1 << node)` to check
Used in TSP, bitmask DP problems

concepts.title: Understanding
checklist: To negate: flip all bits, add 1

concepts.title: Why It Works
checklist: Adding a number and its negation gives 0 (with overflow ignored)

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: XOR is your friend for finding unique elements
Know the difference between logical and arithmetic shifts
Python integers have arbitrary precision (no overflow)
Use bitmask for state compression in DP
Remember: n & (n-1) clears rightmost set bit

concepts.title: Corner Cases
checklist: Zero (edge case for many bit operations)

concepts.title: Modular Arithmetic
checklist: (a + b) mod m = ((a mod m) + (b mod m)) mod m
(a - b) mod m = ((a mod m) - (b mod m) + m) mod m
(a × b) mod m = ((a mod m) × (b mod m)) mod m

concepts.title: Power Function
checklist: With mod: Apply mod after each operation

concepts.title: GCD (Greatest Common Divisor)
checklist: Iterative: `while b: a, b = b, a % b; return a`
Recursive: `gcd(b, a % b)` with base case `b == 0`

concepts.title: LCM (Least Common Multiple)
checklist: Formula: `lcm(a, b) = a * b // gcd(a, b)`

concepts.title: Extended Euclidean Algorithm
checklist: Find x, y such that: ax + by = gcd(a, b)
Pattern: Recursive, track coefficients through recursion

concepts.title: Check if Prime
checklist: Base cases: n < 2 → False, n == 2 → True, even → False
Check divisors from 3 to √n, skip evens

concepts.title: Sieve of Eratosthenes
checklist: Find all primes up to n
Pattern: Mark all multiples of each prime starting from i²
Time: O(n log log n) | Space: O(n)

concepts.title: Prime Factorization
checklist: Pattern: Divide by 2, then odd numbers up to √n
If n > 1 after loop, n itself is prime factor

concepts.title: Count Divisors
checklist: Pattern: For i from 1 to √n, if i divides n, count += 2 (unless i = √n)

concepts.title: Factorial
checklist: With mod: Apply mod after each multiplication

concepts.title: Permutations
checklist: Number of ways to arrange r items from n

concepts.title: Combinations (nCr)
checklist: Pascal's Triangle property: C(n,r) = C(n-1,r-1) + C(n-1,r)
Optimize: Use smaller of r and n-r
With mod: Use modular inverse for division

concepts.title: Pascal's Triangle
checklist: Each row: start/end with 1, middle = sum of two above
Row n gives all C(n, k) values

concepts.title: Catalan Numbers
checklist: Applications: valid parentheses, BST count, polygon triangulation

concepts.title: What is Modular Inverse?
checklist: a^(-1) mod m such that: a × a^(-1) ≡ 1 (mod m)

concepts.title: Using Fermat's Little Theorem
checklist: If m is prime: a^(-1) ≡ a^(m-2) (mod m)

concepts.title: Using Extended Euclidean
checklist: Works for any coprime a and m
Get x from extended_gcd, handle negative result

concepts.title: GCD/LCM Problems
checklist: X of a Kind in a Deck of Cards

concepts.title: Area Formulas
checklist: **Polygon Area**: Apply Shoelace to all vertices

concepts.title: Matrix Exponentiation
checklist: Efficient Fibonacci using matrix: F(n) via [[1,1],[1,0]]ⁿ
Solve linear recurrences in O(k³ log n)
**Key Idea**: Convert recurrence to matrix form, use binary exponentiation
**Time Complexity**: O(k³ log n) where k = matrix size

concepts.title: Basic Probability
checklist: P(A ∪ B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A ∩ B)

concepts.title: Digit Manipulation
checklist: **Sum of Digits**: Iterate digits via n % 10 and n // 10
**Reverse Number**: Build reversed number digit by digit

concepts.title: Ceiling Division
checklist: **Ceiling(a/b)**: Use (a + b - 1) / b to avoid floating point

concepts.title: Things to Look Out For
checklist: Always use MOD = 10^9 + 7 for large numbers
Know GCD (Euclidean algorithm) and fast power
Use Sieve for multiple prime queries (precompute)
Division with mod requires modular inverse
Python has arbitrary precision - still use mod for consistency

concepts.title: Common Mistakes
checklist: Forgetting to take mod at each step (overflow)
Wrong order of operations with mod
Not handling n=0 or n=1 base cases

concepts.title: Pattern Priority for Interviews (AlgoMonster ROI Data)
Algorithms You Can SKIP (Very Rarely Asked)
Grind 75 (Recommended Order)
checklist: Week 1: Two Sum, Valid Parentheses, Merge Two Sorted Lists, Best Time to Buy/Sell Stock
Week 2: Valid Palindrome, Invert Binary Tree, Valid Anagram, Binary Search
Week 3: Linked List Cycle, Implement Queue using Stacks, First Bad Version
Week 4: Ransom Note, Climbing Stairs, Longest Palindrome, Majority Element
Week 5-8: Continue with medium problems from each category
